trans-unit.source: Importing '{0}' would change the meaning of other identifiers in this file. To correct '{1}' and preserve the meaning of other identifiers, choose one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: L'importation de '{0}' modifierait la signification d'autres identificateurs dans ce fichier. Pour corriger '{1}' et conserver la signification des autres identificateurs, sélectionnez une des options suivantes :
trans-unit.note: Defines the replacement string for use in the main label of the Add Imports collision dialog.

Defines the replacement string for use in "Imports Anyways" option of the add imports collision dialog. This text will be formated as richtext.
See the comments for AddImportsMainTextFormatString for more details about the richt text formating codes contained in this resource.
Also, the "&" is used to define the mnemonic character for the radio button associated with the label this text will be inserted into.

trans-unit.target: Ne pas i&mporter '{0}', mais remplacer '{1}' par '{2}'.
trans-unit.note:
Defines the replacement string for use in the "Qualify Current Line" option of the Add Imports collision dialog. This text will be formated as richtext.
See the comments for AddImportsMainTextFormatString for more details about the richt text formating codes contained in this resource.
Also, the "&" is used to define the mnemonic character for the radio button associated with the label this text will be inserted into.

trans-unit.source: Importing '{0}' would change the meaning of other code in your file, including calls to extension methods. Click OK to correct '{1}' by changing it to '{2}'
trans-unit.target: L'importation de '{0}' modifierait la signification d'une autre partie du code contenu dans votre fichier, notamment les appels aux méthodes d'extension. Cliquez sur OK pour corriger '{1}' en le remplaçant par '{2}'
